availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James D. W. Lovan (Hopkins County, KY, laborer and prvt 2nd Batt Ky Cav (csa) + Morgan's men)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Gabriel G. Lovan and Frances Wilson Lovan. Student in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1850. Day laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Battalion Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private from January 14, 1863 to May 31, 1865. Reported as a prisoner of war on September 10, 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U. S. government at Nashville, Tennessee, on May 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 62B-63A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 693.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 594.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 209A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #30681.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0019.
